page.title: 11ANNANDALE WILDLIFE
page.content: In the wooded area at Barnhill and Beechwood Roe and Fallow Deer have been spotted.Toads and Frogs can be seen in almost every pond in the area. Weasels and Stoats are attracted into the area by birds eggs which they eat in Summer.Foxes are attracted by Mice,Voles,Shrews and Rabbits. It can be seen that the survey area contains a wide variety of habitats for plants and animals.Local naturalists and ornithologists are however disturbed by the number of habitats which are vanishing from the area.Commercial forestry,land improvement and drainage schemes are seen to be responsible.Happily,a number of bodies including Forestry groups,youth organisations and the Wildlife Club are joining to preserve some of the more traditional habitats.
